reviewText: If you have seen VHS or dvd versions of these 2 movies, they were ok, but the Blu-ray experience makes the colors and sound pop even more, not to mention the screen filling scenes.  Viewed on an LCD HD screen, plus 5.1 surround sound, the movie experience was more enjoyable now they're in Blu-ray format.  The price was worth it.

Without question these are two movies from Tom Hanks illustrious career that rank at or somply near the top of the list. Both films are so much deepeer and thought provoking than what's on the surface and both provide non stop entertainment from start to finish.

Having gotten the Best Picture nod, Forrest Gump, is of course the more popular than The Green Mile but in no way, in my opinion is it inferior. If you're building a DVD library then this dobule feature is sommething you'll want to own. Your heirs will be oh so grateful to you!

Two great films based on a book (Gump) and a short story (Mile). Tom Hanks shines in these two films, showcasing his versatility as an actor. Both were award-winning for different reasons. Everyone knows Gump, but many may have forgotten the fantasy story of Green Mile. The double-feature prices makes this a no-brainer. Be advised that Forrest Gump is available as a stand-alone two-disk Blu Ray film with tons of extras, if you care about those.

You know these are great movies. Forrest Gump seems a bit cheesier than I remembered it, but still much fun to watch. The Green Mile is the reason I bought it, one of the best (if not the best) Steven King adaptations. The picture and sound in both movies are significant improvements from the DVDs I had in the past.

Just a heads up: Forrest Gump's disc is labelled "Disc One" which means there are some special features you are probably missing out on by not buying it individually and getting the other disc(s). For those with non-DTS capable surround systems, The Green Mile has Dolby 5.1, Forrest Gump is DTS Surround, or Dolby Stereo (English)

Gump's extras disc is not to be found here. You need the full 2 disc. Since I have seen them all and don't plan on revisiting I didn't really care much. You can also find them on youtube or the net most likely. It does have commentary and that is really all I need. The picture looks amazing with a good solid bitrate.

Green Mile is more or less a great film with a fairly solid bluray transfer. It does have a bitrate that is pretty low around 18Mbps, but the film is dark and very long, which should help it along some. I wouldn't call it the greatest transfer but for under 10 bucks I am not going to complain much. Most people know enough about these films from other reviews. I'd say both are classics in the genre they are attributed to. Seeing them in hi-def is well worth your time. Just make sure you get a good deal on the set. Mine was 7.99.
Great movies in a single package. Blu-ray is the best way to go specially for such good movies. I would recommend this two for one movie deal to everyone.

Forrest Gump is the best movie ever made. It illustrates the power of positive thinking in action. The premise is that Forrest was too "dumb" to be effected by the negativity around him. If only I could be that dumb. Live life like Forrest. Love life like Forrest. Do what you say you will do. Focus on what you can do and not what you can't. Persevere until you accomplish your goals despite, and in spite of every obstacle before you. And remain loyal to those you love despite their flaws. If everyone lived like Forrest, the world would be a beautiful place!

This is a great budget release if you just want The Green Mile and Forrest Gump on Blu-ray minus a few extras.  The individual "Sapphire Series" Blu-ray release of Forrest Gump is a two-disc set; this collection only comes with Disc 1 (which includes the movie, two commentary tracks and a featurette or two).  The Green Mile, on the other hand, is exactly the same as the stand-alone release.  Both feature great A/V presentations and, of course, a handful of solid extras.  But if you're looking for the "total package" Forrest Gump release, you'll have to buy it separately.
